intro: Crepidomanes chevalieri, commonly known as the French spurge, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which can be toxic. The plant typically grows in moist, shady areas and has alternate, heart-shaped leaves. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Crepidomanes chevalieri is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade.
